item.title: Quite a bit hole that needs filling with soil on the grass verge, 16th January
item.description:
I have spoke to someone working for Gloucestershire County Council today that was filling in a pot hole. He said to report it. He said they would come out and fill it with soil.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tobyfield Road, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Loads of pot holes along this stretch of road need sorting asap. I’ve just damaged a tyre & alloy on this road !!!!, 16th January
item.description:
From Pilgrove Way right up past the new housing estate being built.Both sides of the carriageway are shocking ! Travelling from Cheltenham to Churchdown & back the other way. This is now in desperate need of a complete resurface. So many potholes & patches it’s unbelievable
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose Manhole cover. Loud noise every time it is driven over, 16th January
item.description:
Outside 45 Gotherington Lane. Every time a car goes over it we here it. Every time a bus goes over it our house rattles and we are not directly on Gotherington Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Gotherington Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Single pothole outside no 119 Melville Road, 16th January
item.description:
Single pothole is filled with loose stones. Further up the road outside 129 and two potholes close together very similar in dimensions to the one outside 119. These potholes have been there for some months are are steadily getting worse. There are smaller ones present as well on different parts of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melville Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Diseased tree causing large branches to fall - danger to pedestrians & cars, 16th January
item.description:
Tree outside 4 Byron Road, St Marks, Cheltenham. Last year the wrong tree was cut down outside 4 Tennyson Rd - the problem tree is outside 4 Byron Road - it is a danger - you will note, if you scroll in to attached pix, large broken branches due to fall when weather turns windy… branches falling daily as tree looks diseased - thank you ..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Tennyson Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another stretch of road that is causing unnecessary damage to cars, 16th January
item.description:
Another stretch of road that needs attention! Terrible state of repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Withybridge Lane, Tewkesbury

item.title: A whole road left uneven and riddled with potholes but plenty in the budget for a cycle path!, 16th January
item.description:
This whole stretch of road is disgraceful with the uneven surface and multiple pot holes which need attention to avoid an accident occurring now that the carriageway is greatly reduced in width! Maybe pull some of the budget used for the never ending cycle path works (hardly see a cycle using it) and put the road right! Use my taxes appropriately please!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wood Lane, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excess water flooding across road, particularly dangerous during current icy weather, 16th January
item.description:
Corndean Lane, Winchcombe. As leaving Winchcombe along Corndean Lane, past the entrance to the playing field on the righthand side, water flooding across road and freezing in current conditions
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corndean Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: The edge of the tarmac drops sharply for large stretches of the road on both sides., 16th January
item.description:
Bubbs Hill between High Cross and The Green Dragon. Eight vehicles last week are known to have broken down or been damaged because of this problem. I am the District Councillor for Elkstone and at last week's meeting the Parish Councillors expressed great concern about this issue. Matt Hobbs is the Chair and witnessed the breakdowns, including a suspected twisted axle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elkstone, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reported as pothole as no other option, 16th January
item.description:
Problem is a depression in the road surface as if a sinkhole is possibly forming underneath or subsurface has been washed away or compromised by a water leak, stretches 80% across the entrance to the roadway into the garages area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Harrison Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
